messages.message: Raman's PR only touched webserver, it doesn't strike to me why it will affect ray, which is under data-services, why do we expect the CI to run tests under there? if we do then we need to explictly claim the dependency

The PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/60675/files) touched api-server which has a dependency on ray.
Api-server uses the ray client to trigger model-training tasks.

hmm I think our CI job may need some update for this, it might be ignoring those poetry updates:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/10203374493/job/28229574344
I will dig a bit more to see what is going on

@shiqi just to clarify in case there is any misunderstanding, ray-head or ray-model-training-worker CI shouldn't run but we do expect CI to run for api-server; if we have run api-server CI it would have caught the failure

I see, thanks for the clarification, api-server is expected to run in this case, along with apps-server and web-app. we will look into why they are not included in the change detection script for CI

we do have a post-merge unit test run that could have caught this but I was updating the cluster and put it on hold
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/workflows/pyunit-test.yml

also it seems there are a few breakage on other backend tests
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C073F3T5KRQ/p1722905612354459
